results.title: The Cell: a functioning structure. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Steven Katten and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description: Uses cinemicroscopy and animation to show chemical events which take place within the living cell. Describes genetic code and DNA and the role of RNA. Also discusses the chloroplast of the plant cell and investigates cellular communications. Features Dr Donald Fosket. Hosted and narrated by Dr David Suzuki.
results.description: Uses cinemicroscopy and animation to show chemical events which take place within the living cell. Describes genetic code and DNA and the role of RNA. results.title: The Cell: a functioning structure. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Steven Katten and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description: Uses cinemicroscopy and special-effects animation to present the cell as a functioning entity as well as a stable, reproducible structure. The key functions of DNA and protein enzymes are revealed along with the way cells obtain nourishment and includes a discussion on cellular reproduction and cell structure. Narrated and hosted by Dr David Suzuki.

results.title: The Ceiling of the Sistine Chapel
results.brief_description: A study of the Michelangelo paintings on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel in the Vatican. At the beginning of the sixteenth century, Bramante drew the plans for the new Basilica of St. Peter. Raphael peopled the halls in the Vatican with figures and stories of ideal beauty and Michelangelo displayed on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel that history of mankind which bears witness to the superhuman task of a superhuman spirit.

results.title: The Catherine Wheel
results.brief_description: Twyla Tharp, a leading choreographer, and David Byrne of “Talking Heads” fame have worked together to masterfully crosscut fragments of emotion through music and movement. This breathtaking and explosive piece of dance theatre broke new ground in modern dance and music. Rated: G

results.title: The Cathedral Engineers
results.brief_description: Aesthetic appreciation and scientific investigation combine in this program, which highlights the architectural triumph of the Middle Ages. The engineering achievements of the cathedrals at Chartres, Bourges, and Beauvais are analysed by photoelastic modelling, and the distribution of forces and dangerous stresses are explained.
results.description: Aesthetic appreciation and scientific investigation combine in this program, which highlights the architectural triumph of the Middle Ages. results.title: The Caterpillar and the Polliwog (K)
results.creator_credit: Daniel Ivanick, Paul R. Gagne, DMI Productions and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: When I grow up I’m going to turn into something else, the caterpillar boasts to her friends. When the polliwog discovers that he, too, will turn into something else, he tells the caterpillar, and off they go to change into butterflies. While the polliwog waits patiently for his friend to emerge from her cocoon, he doesn’t notice that he is changing too - but not into a butterfly. From the book by Jack Kent.

results.title: The Cat in the hat
results.brief_description: Impulsive and imaginative, the Cat romps through the house dispelling boredom for a brother and sister on a rainy day, while their mother is away. Invites children to become self-sufficient in their use of time. Adapted from the book by Dr. Seuss.
